hal::Core Class Reference

Documentation

This is the Core class. It is used to access core MCU information such as clock speed and to adjust interrupt priorities.

Here is an example of how to read the MCU serial number:

#include <stfy/hal.hpp>
#include <cstdio>
int main(int argc, char * argv[]){
int i;
Core core(0);
core_attr_t attr;
core.open();
core.attr(&attr);
printf("Serial Number is:");
for(i=3; i >= 0; i--){
printf("%X", attr.serial_number[i]);
}
printf("\n");
core.close(); //core is never "powered-down" but this frees the file descriptor
}

Member Function Documentation

int hal::Core::get_attr ( core_attr_t &  attr)

Gets attributes of the Core peripheral and stores them in attr.

int hal::Core::get_mcu_board_config ( mcu_board_config_t &  config)

Loads the MCU board configuration data provided by the board support package.

Parameters
configA reference to the destination data
Returns
Zero on success
void hal::Core::invoke_bootloader ( )

Invokes the device's bootloader. If no bootloader is availble, a normal reset will occur.

void hal::Core::reset ( )

Resets the device.

int hal::Core::set_attr ( const core_attr_t &  attr)

Sets the attributes for the Core device.

int hal::Core::set_clkout ( const core_clkout_t *  clkout)

Configures the clock output pin.

int hal::Core::set_pin_function ( const core_pinfunc_t *  req)

Executes a request to set the functionality of a pin.

int hal::Core::set_pin_function ( const core_pinfunc_t &  req)
inline

Changes pin functionality using a core_pinfunc_t structure.

int hal::Core::set_pin_function ( int  port,
int  pin,
int  func,
int  func_port 
)
inline

Changes pin function.

Parameters
portThe PIO port
pinThe PIO pin number
funcThe function (e.g. Core::UART)
func_portThe functional port (e.g. 0 for UART0)
Returns
Zero on success

This can be used if the default pinassign values are not adequate for your application.

int hal::Core::sleep ( core_sleep_t  level)

Causes the device to sleep at the specified sleep level.
